channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Retirement is within my grasp’: I’m 57, my 401(k) is dropping and I’m feeling anxious about a recession. What can I do?
item.description: “I feel like I’m fiddling while Wall Street burns.”

item.title: McDonald’s sees lower foot traffic as revenue misses Wall Street expectations
item.description: Fast-food giant says consumers continue to grapple with economic uncertainty.

item.title: Medical-products maker Becton Dickinson says cuts in global research funding have hurt sales
item.description: “It’s become clear that pressure on research spending increased in the second quarter and will likely persist through fiscal year 2025,” the company s...

item.title: Bulls beware: A volatile stock market like this one is dangerous and can easily turn
item.description: What began as an oversold rally in early April is now generating some buy signals, but that doesn’t mean all is bullish again.

item.title: ‘We are the most privileged’: My husband and I are tired of paying for our friends. How do we get them to pay their way?
item.description: “My husband almost always ends up paying for everyone or picks up the entire bill.”

item.title: Josh Brown says Microsoft's breakout is unique, don't expect that to apply to every other Big Tech
item.description: The co-founder and CEO of Ritholtz Wealth Management said it's too soon for investors to extrapolate what could be an idiosyncratic story at Microsoft...

item.title: Finding a Tesla CEO who can captivate investors like Musk would be 'tall task,' says UBS
item.description: Tesla has denied a Wall Street Journal report, but the story highlights how "perhaps no other company has as large a key man risk," UBS analysts said.

item.title: Goldman adds J&J to its 'conviction list.' Here's who else is on it
item.description: Goldman Sachs updated its conviction list for May.

item.description: Here are the firm's contrarian stock picks.
